attributes.action: Change the driving license rules for up to 7.5 tonne vehicles.
attributes.background: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) Regulations 1996 needs to be adapted to include C1 and C1E category after provisional on a background check-points basis so that all the people who were born from 1979 onwards get the same driving possibilities as those who passed their driving test before 1996.
attributes.additional_details: As it stands today, anyone who has passed their driving test prior to 1996 can drive any vehicle up to 7.5 tonnes. In 1998 this meant that a few thousand 18 and 19 year-olds were left out of the equation but by 2016, not only everybody from 18 to 37 (roughly 16.8 million people) can't drive a large van or small lorry but your 75 year-old granny can. This leaves many responsible grown-ups finding it very difficult when needing to drive, hire or purchase any vehicle between 3.5 and 7.5 tonnes.

attributes.action: We have no right to light. I think people should be entitled to light
attributes.background: I recently asked the local council to cut some trees that block daylight on my property and disabled neighbours nextdoor. I was advised I have no right to light and the law states this.

attributes.action: Provide bursaries for mental health training
attributes.background: Psychotherapy and counselling training is lengthy and expensive. Mental health is crying out for more trained professionals. I would like to see incentivised grants to help attract more people to the profession, and to help those attracted, but without the funds to study.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has a teacher shortage. As a result, the Government introduced incentivised bursaries to attract more people to train as teachers. The mental health profession has an even bigger shortage, yet training is both lengthy and very expensive. If we are to help deal with the deficit of appointments and patients on waiting lists, then access to training needs is a necessity.

Please support this important campaign to help provide more professionals in such an underresourced sector.

attributes.action: Stop the bidding and banding system for new council/housing associations
attributes.background: This is for a better housing allocations as the bidding and banding system does not work for a lot of people and are left living in a place there not happy and doesn't meet the needs for the family
attributes.additional_details: I have been living i n a poky 2 bed ground floor flat for 5years and is not suitable for us as my child has hardly any space and bidding does not get us any where something seriously need to change please sign this petition to get a chance to get what we all need and deserve

attributes.action: Declare Richmond park in London, car free Zone
attributes.background:
One of the very few places in London, where Londoners and visitors can enjoy, walking, cycling and generally being close to nature without having to leave London. 

The experience, however, is very much spoiled by increased risk of accidents due to huge number of cars driving around the park.
attributes.additional_details: Declare Richmond park in London, car free Zone. If this is not possible, the park should be car-free at the weekends.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading laws.
attributes.background: Scotland has abolished them, so why can't we!

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Payments applied to a Card that is regularly reviewed.
attributes.background: Child Maintenance Visa Cards would ensure that the hard earned cash is being spent on the child and not the mother. Accounts should be reviewed every quarter and receipts should need to be submitted monthly to confirm what had been spent. A app that lets you scan the receipts would keep things easy.
attributes.additional_details: Fathers who pay child maintenance for children should be allowed to see that their hard earned money is actually being spent on supporting the child, instead it is seen as a position of power and a way to undermine the father, the idea is to provide mothers with a card that can be monitored to ensure the money is being spent correctly, for example say there's £300 on the card and only £100 is spent that month the £200 left over should be put into a savings account for the child's 18th birthday?

attributes.action: Put an end to the driving theory process.
attributes.background: The driving theory test that is required in the UK is a complete nonsense. It wasn't deemed necessary in former years and it shouldn't be relevant now. Why should a memory test dictate whether you are suitable to drive? It is simply a money making scheme, which is highly unfair on young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Problems:
- Memory based.
- Favours those who prefer exams conditions.
- It keeps competent young drivers off the roads.
- It drains the money of millions of young people
- It wasn't deemed important years ago so why is it important now?

attributes.action: Allocate MPS seat in parliament according to their last name.
attributes.background: Placing those who represent us opposite each-other, in confrontation, creates a division that separates them and that they use as a fence, many times feeling comfortable attacking and shouting to each-other which would dramatically change if you allocate sitting in the house by alphabetical order.
attributes.additional_details:
Symbols, and orders have a strong impact in reality and in the way humans interact and relate to each other. A feasible way to start unifying this country is by simply making the members of parliament sit among members of the "opposition".  
That is how we, the people, that have given you this job, live and interact in society, and reflecting this in the house, would bring us a step closer to negotiate, to have compassion, to stop thinking of rivals and start thinking of building together.

attributes.action: Stop night time road closures which is costing haulage companies millions
attributes.background: Road closures during the night are costing lorry drivers millions in lost time and fuel. The diversions off of some motorways can add an hour on to a journey. It seems like the highways agency find it easier to close a road rather put a contaflow in place.

attributes.action: Dissolve parliament.
attributes.background: Introduce compulsory voting and allow us the electorate to vote for and elect two individuals from each constituency
attributes.additional_details:
Adopt a 5 year parliament term, with an independently elected Prime Minster also on a 5 year term but elected out of sync at the 2.5 year mark so the PM serves across at least two parliaments and the MP's (possibly) serve two PM's during their terms in office.

HRH Prince William would be the ideal solution as the appointed Chief Executive of the country until the first new PM is installed. One day .

attributes.action: Change Education Sector Staff Holidays to normal annual leave arrangements.
attributes.background: As this is paid for through public moneys including full pay through 7 or 8 weeks summer holidays this should be modernised to a annual leave policy in line with modern practices. The pupil breaks could see local and national improvement groups for education or indeed local school policy works.

attributes.action: Take down the government petition site.
attributes.background: Increasingly the government's petition site is being used for more & more frivolous purposes such votes of no confidence in individual ministers and efforts to reverse the result of the EU vote. These petitions are undemocratic in their nature and simply a means to complain having lost an election
attributes.additional_details:
EU Referendum petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/131215

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36634407

Examples of unnecessary "no confidence" petitions.

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/123469

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/111975

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/121152

attributes.action: Ban redoing referendums
attributes.background: We should not redo referendums

attributes.action: Greater taxation on the tabloid press for mis informing the population on Brexit
attributes.background: It is the tabloid press that have been responsible for mis informing the public regarding Brexit.  Their xenophobic views are polluting the minds of the majority of the population. The economy will suffer as a result of this, therefore this is a way of supporting the British economy
attributes.additional_details: Their continued barracking of the England team selection, resulted in the wrong team being selected by Roy Hodgson.  This was the sole reason England failed to beat Iceland.  Evidence is the bilge they have printed for the last 6 months, which is resulting in minorities of the population being targeted across the country.  Reference all the Murdoch press and other tabloid toilet paper

attributes.action: Vote under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act for a general election in 2018.
attributes.background: We will soon begin exit negotiations with the EU. It is essential that the British people be given a chance to vote on Brexit again, on an informed basis, once the terms of exit are known. In the referendum, we had to vote on the basis of contradictory predictions by the Leave and Remain campaigns.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act, an election can only be held before May 2020 if a vote of No Confidence in the government is passed or if at least 434 MPs vote for an early election. The decision no longer rests with the Prime Minister.
The EU Article 50 process cannot, in theory, be stopped once it has begun. However, in political terms, if the UK elected a government committed to remaining in the EU, it is highly probable that the EU would find a way to secure its continued membership.

attributes.action: Defer any action to leave European Union for three year or until next Election.
attributes.background: Britain has just voted to leave European Union. The process will not start until notice under article 50 is given to EU. Britain should take its own time before giving such notice and in the meanwhile try to obtain reforms such as on immigration and benefits before starting the leave process.
attributes.additional_details: EU wants Britain to leave quickly and want to make this process as a difficult divorce. Britain does not need to rush and should take time before even tendering the notice to leave and making efforts to bring reforms. This is in EU interest as well.

attributes.action: Work Permit For Athletes Easy Accepted Aslong As Team Provides Proof Of Contact!
attributes.background: If we do not grant athletes easy workpermits then the best football league in the world will suffer. This will mean the quality of the league will drop and tourists that come over to watch the games may find alternative leagues and teams too follow which will then effect local companies

attributes.action: Bring back milk for primary school children
attributes.background: When I was younger we always had a small milk bottle with a straw. I think it's really important for children to get calcium and in this busy day and age ensures that all children get some milk.

attributes.action: British people want more funding put into: science, public services & education.
attributes.background:
We all know that our public services (e.g. NHS) are under stress, that more science means more advancement and that more education means less misinformation.
So help to try and get more funding from the British government for these areas.

attributes.action: We must have a 2nd EU Referendum: Vote restricted to those aged 16 to 50 years.
attributes.background: The result of the first referendum is essentially a tie.  The result of the first referendum is made null and void by the deliberate misinformation and lies of both the Leave and Remain campaigns.  The first referendum failed to recognise that the primary stakeholders are the young and not the old.
attributes.additional_details: The political elite and the political media have entirely failed the British people. The 2nd referendum should only take place once a mechanism has been devised to moderate the arguments put forward by the Remain and Leave campaigns.  At the very least, arguments would require references which support the argument, in a similar way to academic papers being considered for publication in a journal.

attributes.action: Increase minimum wage for over 25s to £10.00 hour.
attributes.background: Minimum wage for over 25s is set to increase in April next year. This is is not good/quick enough. The minimum wage for over 25 currently stands at £7.20ph.
attributes.additional_details: Minimum wage should increase for over 25s from £7.20 to £10.00, £7.20 is not a liveable wage at all, it's time for a new minimum wage to take place straight away.

attributes.action: Debate security implications of the removal of U.K. border controls from Calais.
attributes.background: Politicians in France are calling on President Hollande to scrap immigration checks on the French side of the English Channel following UK's vote to leave the EU. We need to know what this means for the UK.

attributes.action: Over 60's should not be able to vote on our generations issues!
attributes.background: Anything from the EU vote to who becomes the new leader of the country are all decisions which will affect the current and young generation most. We are the ones who'll be living and dealing with the changes allot more. People who are older don't have to worry so much, our youth are your future!
attributes.additional_details: The youth are the future of the nation however the voices of the past get heard allot more! this has to stop.

attributes.action: Create basic check to ensure voters understand what they are voting about/on
attributes.background:
One of the benefits of being a British citizen is the right to vote, and to know that your vote has the power to influence laws, policies, taxes and more. 

It should be the duty of the government to British democracy to ensure and check that voters understand what they are voting on/about.
attributes.additional_details:
One example: an increase in the Google search term "What is the EU?" within the UK, the day after these searchers potentially voted on it. 
http://www.techinsider.io/what-is-the-eu-is-top-google-search-in-uk-after-brexit-2016-6

attributes.action: To strengthen Sections 28 to 32 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (Anti-Racism)
attributes.background:
The result of the EU referendum has lead to incidents of racist abuse.
UK immigrants, residents, and foreign nationals would benefit from reassurance and the strengthening of protection at this time. The government have an opportunity to strengthen the sentencing powers in relation to racial crime.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition to a heightened period of public concern, tension, and political unrest; the tenor and rhetoric of the 'Leave campaign' in relation to immigration may result in a perception and presumption that the public airing of racist comments are an acceptable expression of views.

Evidence of some racist incidents can be found here: https://www.facebook.com/sarah.leblanc.718/media_set?set=a.10101369198638985.223406919&type=3

attributes.action: People who save for a pension shouldn't be taxed on it when they retire.
attributes.background: People who save for a pension do so and reduce their monthly spend. A pension is to help in later life when you need every penny. I had less of a life style to ensure I could look after my family in my later years. No taxing pensions when you retire would also encourage more to save.

attributes.action: Criminalise politicians and the media for lying, misleading or misinforming.
attributes.background: The EU referendum was the biggest decision in modern history. But the decision made was based on lies, misinformation and speculation. We need an independent body with the power to impose legal repercussions on politicians and media organisations for circulating misleading or untrue claims.
attributes.additional_details:
Gisela Stuart, Boris Johnson and Michael Gove said: 
"After we Vote Leave, there won’t be a sudden change that disrupts the economy." Yet the Brexit vote triggered the biggest fall in the pound in history.
Nigel Farage disowns Vote Leave '£350m for the NHS pledge' hours after EU referendum result. Also, the £350 million figure was deemed 'misleading' (UK Statistics Authority). 
The Sun published "The Queen backs Brexit" - Buckingham Palace complained to IPSO about this claim.

attributes.action:
-Extend EU exit interim period to 5years.
-Final Decision Referendum in Year 5.
attributes.background: The EU referendum was too close to be conclusive, and the future of the UK too uncertain to leave the EU in 2 years. We the undersigned request that the interim exit period be extended to 5 years with a Final Decision Referendum taking place in Year 5. We do not want this http://bit.ly/28TVrjb

attributes.action: To implement a national standard for the design of cycle lanes by cyclists.
attributes.background: A lot of money has been spent recently on local cycle schemes that have been very poorly implimented; therefore not having the desired effect and in some places making the roads more dangerous for all road users. I believe there should be a national standard for the design of cycle routes and paths.
attributes.additional_details:
£29 million cycle route with very poor sections - http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/news/design-of-flagship-29m-leeds-to-bradford-cycle-superhighway-will-set-cycling-back-1-7916928
Some photos of poorly placed cycle lanes -https://www.theguardian.com/environment/gallery/2009/nov/05/readers-worst-cycle-https://www.buzzfeed.com/jonstone/22-london-cycle-lanes-that-hate-cyclists?utm_term=.fee8zBePA#.qta6MxrlB

attributes.action: Increased court powers and sentences for racially motivated attacks.
attributes.background: In the wake of the referendum, there have been massively increased reports of racially motivated attacks on foreign born nationals and Muslims. We need much tougher sentences to stop this from becoming the norm.

attributes.action: Renegotiate a better deal with the EU before a 2nd referendum
attributes.background: The Government should return to the negotiating table with the EU to attempt to secure a better deal for the UK to remain, acceptable to the British public, which could then be offered to the British people in a 2nd referendum BEFORE Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty is invoked.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron negotiated the deal with the EU from a position of weakness, by declaring beforehand that he wanted to remain. The referendum result has resulted in a general acceptance within the EU that change is needed. Now that it is clear to Europe that we WILL leave under the present conditions, we should offer the EU a 2nd referendum IF AND ONLY IF a more acceptable deal, addressing voters key concerns over immigration, can be offered to the British Electorate.

attributes.action: Parliament must not recess until there is a  ratified plan post-referendum
attributes.background: The electorate needs leadership and understanding. Parliament must sit until this is achieved. All facts and assertions must be independently verified and it must be a contempt of Parliament to knowingly supply, support or provide inaccurate or misleading information.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is in danger of disintegration. Leadership is needed.

attributes.action: Disallow MPs from of having secondary employment with a conflict of interest
attributes.background: I believe an mp should not be allowed a say in matter of interest, where they have role in private companies that have a vested interest in the sector. For example, someone with a role in private medical care industry, should have no say in the NHS. I believe this to be unethical.

attributes.action: Restrict petition signatories to 1 UK IP addresses ONLY to prevent further abuse
attributes.background: The petitions system is being blatantly abused by people who feel it is OK to use false data and sign a petition multiple times (and even write scripts to automate it), and that most critically non-eligible voters, outside of the UK are being allowed to steer our democratic process through fraud.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the expansion of social media, viral ideas are able to spread globally in minutes.  As we have seen in several recent petitions that have exploded overnight, that people on twitter, Facebook, 4chan, etc. are actively promoting petition fraud by having people sign using false UK addresses, and fraudulently declaring themselves to be eligible UK voters.  THIS MUST BE STOPPED.  It would be easily implemented (reduced) if Geographic IP filters are introduced, and IP addresses logged.

attributes.action: Create an independent cross-party & cross-industry task force to manage Brexit
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is such a big deal. There needs to be an independent body or committee tasked to re-negotiate a new deal that represents all UK citizens & UK businesses. This task force should have cross-party & industry-wide representation to ensure the re-negotiation with the EU is fair & balanced.

attributes.action: support china's claim over the south china sea
attributes.background: China's claim over the south china sea has historic routes and china has pushed for countries to recognize its rightful claim to the south china sea. Thus far however the UK has refused to do so. The UK should recognize China's claim over it to both strengthen ties and recognize a historical claim.

attributes.action: Make voting eligible to only those who have paid PAYE tax for 5 or more years
attributes.background: Due to the backlash from the EU referendum from individuals who have no interest in what happens to the ordinary citizen and big businesses who are only interested in lining their pockets, we wish there to restrictions where only those who have paid into the country may vote for it's future.

attributes.action: Make York a union with London to remain in the EU
attributes.background: York voted to remain in the EU by 58%. This is the historical capital of the North of England and was the second city until the industrial revolution. York can develop a second financial and political centre and should join London to stay in the EU.

attributes.action: Call for a referendum in N.Ireland to decide if it remains part of the UK
attributes.background: The people of Northern Ireland have clearly decided that they want to remain a part of the European Union. Nigel Farage has lied to us, we want justice. We, the people of Northern Ireland, want to be freed. We ask that we can be allowed a referendum on the basis of our vote on the EU referendum.

attributes.action: A referendum for England to leave to United Kingdom.
attributes.background: This is an action created in the hope that, like a Scottish independence referendum, would enable England to remain within the EU.

attributes.action: Do not allow a second referendum on the EU to take place within the next 5 years
attributes.background: The nation has spoken and the result has been determined. Let's not change the rules after the fact.

attributes.action: Enact legislation to match EU funding for areas defined as Economically Deprived
attributes.background: Legislate guaranteeing to match (and increase in line with the Retail Price Index) current EU funding for areas defined using the EU model as Economically Deprived, post exit from the EU in 2018. This to be in addition to current levels of government investment in such areas and not replacing it.
attributes.additional_details:
This is to ensure financial promises made during the Leave campaign are not forgotten and to maintain investment and growth for the populations of such Economically Deprived areas.
E.g. The total European Regional Development Fund for the 2014-2020 funding period is €3.6bn.

attributes.action: Consider The City Of London as a free independent state. Remaining in the EU
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum decision and rumours of Scotland and Ireland. The United Kingdom has become more divided than ever. It is time for London to stand alone. We ask that the government consider the feasibility of London standing alone and remaining in the EU

attributes.action: Allow UK residents to vote in parliament elections and referendums.
attributes.background: After 5 years of continuous  residence people should be allowed to vote to have an influence on changes that will affect their lifes and residence in the  UK

attributes.action: EU Referendum Rules to be made into Law that the first result stands.
attributes.background: To ensure fairplay in all referendums, the first and only vote is the one that must stand as the result. As a democratic society, any vote with a majority cannot be challenged just because some of the electorate are not happy at the result. There must be no TMO in this situation.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU referndum has been held and a majority of over 1 million voters chose the Leave option. A hardline minority of Remain campaingers have baulked at the result and are now tring to manipulate a democratic voting system by calling for a percentage ruling change. 

There is no actual evidence presented by parliament to support either option in the referendum as to the benefits or negatives of being a member of the EU. 

Any government leader that chose the remain option should now stand down.

attributes.action: Allow legal British permanent residents to vote in referendums after 5 years.
attributes.background: Not everyone living in Britain who meets the citizenship requirements wants to become a British citizen immediately. Permanent residents who have been living and working in the UK for the past 5 years should be afforded the right to vote in a referendum as it pertains to their future as well.
attributes.additional_details: A full list of citizenship requirements can be found at https://www.gov.uk/becoming-a-british-citizen/check-if-you-can-apply

attributes.action: Liverpool to hold their own referendum on leaving England.
attributes.background:
Liverpool has always felt foreign and disconnected from the rest of England. In the aftermath of England leaving the European Union and Liverpool voting to remain We should have our indepence from England. 
After all the EU had done more this city in the last 20 years than anyone in Westminster.

attributes.action: Maximum voting age for national referendums
attributes.background:
Referendum results affect the country in the long-term. Therefore, only voters that are present for the consequences of the vote should be eligible to vote.

The undersigned propose to use a limit of 15 years less than the average life expectancy.

attributes.action: Let 14-18 year olds vote in second EU referendum
attributes.background: It's their future it's affecting, let them have a say! 14-18 year olds to vote in second EU referendum!
